Darkfate/KALI/Shivah::

Darkfate send a secret message to Shiva and go to the coordinates 
that hellpeon had given him.

Shiva opened a commlink to kali and others BlackFortress's 
troops "Help Drillbit and Killfest to destroy  Trainers, master went 
to a secret mission and while he's abset I'm in charge"

Kali said to Drillbit "What will happen now, Drillbit?"

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Legendarynemasis@a... wrote:
> Inside the Infecticon warship, the Oblivion, Frostbite watches the 
> message with great interest. As it ends she smirks and turns to her 
> own gestalt team.
> 
> Frostbite: "You two, prepare we are going to show these 
Cybertronians 
> how to do things. Hellpeon shall enter the individual tournament 
and 
> eliminate all competition."
> 
> THe two archon beings nod and look up as a hologrphic image appears 
> above them. Frostbite then taps a button causing an extremely 
strong 
> transmission to be sent to the IGL tournament area or whatever.
> 
> Frostbite: "This is commander Frostbite of the Infecticon team 
> currently on this planet. We would like to participate in this 
event. 
> We shall send our strongest warrior and our gestalt team to the 
> location of your message to prepare, if this is ok with you. 
Anyways."
> 
> Elsewhere at the Trainer base that should be exploding and taking 
out 
> everthing within 50 miles by now from what Cyber said... The Energy 
> column dissapates and Hellpeon hovers out of its epicenter and 
above 
> the base. Soon afterward he recieves a Telepathic message from 
> Frostbite and Nods. He then speeds off towards the IGL ship. 
Hellpeon 
> was lucky this time seeing as how he would need alot of time to 
> recooperate from releasing that amount of energy. However before he 
> dissapears into the distance, he sends a telepathic message to 
> Darkfate.
> 
> Hellpeon: "Go to sector 44-26-C... Now. You will speak with my 
leader 
> there."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., KSLawdogg@c... wrote:
> > President Kaiser:
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > From atop the exact center of the mighty IGL craft, several 
> antennaes 
> > extending, three orbs blasting off from what looked like three 
> cannons on 
> > other sides, quickly ascending until they were in Earth's orbit, 
> the orbs 
> > transforming into satellites.
> > 
> > With the powerful antennaes and positioning of the satellites the 
> IGL would 
> > be able to communicate with all the major bases rather well and 
> they would 
> > even be able to get their transmission through jamming systems.
> > 
> > Depending on the type of base and its equipment, either an audio 
or 
> audio and 
> > picture message would appear.  Most likely the audio and view of 
> the 
> > President speaking.  The message consisted of:
> > 
> > A slightly menacing robot who was thirteen feet tall, though it 
was 
> hard to 
> > tell with him sitting in a large black luxurious chair.  His body 
> was a 
> > comfortable mix of red and gold.  On primarily red colored chest 
> there was a 
> > golden symbol of the IGL, a sword with a shield behind it.  His 
> blue optic 
> > sensors brightened as he first spoke.
> > 
> > "Congratulations, Cybertronians and any other beings," Kaiser 
> began, his 
> > voice very deep, "I am President Kaiser of the IGL, the 
> Intergalactic 
> > Gladiatorial League.  Now I know you are all busy plotting and 
> scheming 
> > futily to defeat your opponents but believe me, this is a very 
> important 
> > message that could thrust the balance of power into your favor."
> > 
> > "The IGL holds matches year long, but only once every year do 
they 
> hold the 
> > Intergalactic Gladiatorial League Combat Championships.  We were 
> hoping that 
> > some if not almost all of you Cybertronians would participate in 
> this.  There 
> > will be two divisions.  The Regular, and the Gestalt.  The 
regular 
> will 
> > consist of normal combatants with numerous one on one battles 
until 
> there is 
> > a final one on one battle to determine the IGL Champion of the 
> Regular 
> > League.  The victor will receive five protoforms and equipment to 
> make mold 
> > them into anything they desire, including a gestalt team."
> > 
> > "No doubt that would help any faction begin rising to power.  And 
> for the 
> > Gestalt League, all gestalt teams may fight one one, as in one 
> gestalt team 
> > against the other.  These 'one' on 'one' matches will continue 
> until there 
> > are only two teams left and the victor of that final bout will be 
> IGL 
> > Champions of the Gestalt League.  They will receive armor 
> modifications, 200 
> > kilos of liquid energon, and if they fight well enough a 
protoform 
> and 
> > equipment for them to do with as they wish."
> > 
> > "Normally the bouts are not fights to the deaths, but upon 
request 
> and 
> > agreement from the combatants this kind of match can occur (if 
you 
> have any 
> > spare chars. you need to kill off, hint, hint).  A faction may 
> enter as many 
> > warriors into each league as wanted.  In example, one faction 
could 
> enter 
> > twenty-five robots into a league.  Or if they had four gestalt 
> teams, they 
> > could enter them into the league.  Although, they would have to 
> fight each 
> > other as if they were enemies."
> > 
> > "Our craft, the Otyebis, is a mighty ship and assassination is 
not 
> something 
> > to worry about.  If we wanted you dead, it would've been much 
> easier to 
> > simply bombard you from orbit with our grealty superior weapons, 
or 
> overrun 
> > you with our many garrisons of assorted beings.  But that's not 
we 
> will do.  
> > There is a zero tolerance for fighting outside of the arenas.  We 
> will not 
> > allow your petty differences to interfere with our show.  Anyone 
> who attacks 
> > our craft will be obliterated.  If a target of an enemy faction 
is 
> in a 
> > middle of a match and his enemies attempt to interfere, we will 
> crush them."
> > 
> > A smile crept up on the lips of the non-Cybertronian robot.  "You 
> can 
> > register into the IGL by simply sending transmissions to our 
ship, 
> we have 
> > the resouces to deal with constant messages.  You have (two IRL 
> weeks) to 
> > register.  Feel free to ask any questions (send 'em to 
> KSLawDogg@c...) when 
> > you send your transmissions.  This message will replay for 48 
hours 
> in case 
> > anyone misses this message."
> > 
> > The IGL President was replaced by the golden IGL symbol with a 
> background of 
> > red.
> > 
> > (If you have any questions, e-mail me.  This isn't a trick to 
crush 
> people, 
> > Yan won't allow it.  Just something I thought of to add a little 
> spice to the 
> > attack, retreat, attack theme that seems to be going on in the 
> RPG.  Since 
> > Yanshosh and I have characters in the IGL command, we are not 
> allowed to win 
> > because it would seem unfair.  The way the winner will be decided 
> is as if it 
> > were a real battle.  Whoever's character(s) give first lose.  
There 
> will be 
> > no complete retreats, though in some matches there will be 
> different 
> > terrians, such as forest, etc, for people to run and try and hide 
> in if 
> > things get dicy)
